required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ENVISION: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Givosiran (ALN-AS1) in Patients With Acute Hepatic Porphyrias (AHP)
clinical_study.official_title: ENVISION: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-Controlled Multicenter Study With an Open-label Extension to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Givosiran in Patients With Acute Hepatic Porphyrias

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of subcutaneous givosiran (ALN-AS1), compared to placebo, on the rate of porphyria attacks in patients with Acute Hepatic Porphyrias (AHP).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Rate of Porphyria Attacks in Participants With Acute Intermittent Porphyria (AIP)
primary_outcome.description: Porphyria attacks were defined as meeting all of the following criteria: an acute episode of neurovisceral pain in the abdomen, back, chest, extremities and/or limbs, no other medically determined cause, and required treatment with intravenous (IV) dextrose or hemin, carbohydrates, or analgesics, or other medications such as antiemetics at a dose or frequency beyond the participant's usual daily porphyria management. The annualized rate of porphyria attacks is a composite endpoint which included porphyria attacks requiring hospitalization, urgent healthcare visit, or IV hemin administration at home.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Pharmacodynamic (PD) Effect of Givosiran on Urine Levels of Delta-aminolevulinic Acid (ALA) in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: The PD effect of givosiran was evaluated by spot urine ALA levels normalized to spot urine creatinine levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: The PD Effect of Givosiran on Urine Levels of Porphobilinogen (PBG) in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: The PD effect of givosiran was evaluated by spot urine PBG levels normalized to spot urine creatinine levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Rate of Hemin Administration in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized rate of hemin doses was evaluated as annualized days of hemin use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Rate of Porphyria Attacks in Participants With AHP
secondary_outcome.description: Porphyria attacks were defined as meeting all of the following criteria: an acute episode of neurovisceral pain in the abdomen, back, chest, extremities and/or limbs, no other medically determined cause, and required treatment with intravenous (IV) dextrose or hemin, carbohydrates, or analgesics, or other medications such as antiemetics at a dose or frequency beyond the participant's usual daily porphyria management. The annualized rate of porphyria attacks is a composite endpoint which included porphyria attacks requiring hospitalization, urgent healthcare visit, or IV hemin administration at home.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of the Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score of Daily Worst Pain as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF) Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated worst daily pain score in an eDiary using the 11-point BPI-SF NRS, in which 0=no pain and 10=worst pain. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the post baseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement. The 6-month AUC was calculated based on change from baseline in weekly mean scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score of Daily Worst Pain as Measured by the Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-SF) Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated worst daily pain score in an eDiary using the 11-point BPI-SF NRS, in which 0=no pain and 10=worst pain. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the postbaseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of the Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score of Daily Worst Fatigue Score as Measured by the Brief Fatigue Inventory-Short Form (BFI-SF) NRS in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated daily worst fatigue score in an eDiary using the 11-point BFI-SF NRS, in which 0=no fatigue and 10=worst fatigue. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the post baseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement. The 6-month AUC was calculated based on change from baseline in weekly mean scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score of Daily Worst Fatigue Score as Measured by the Brief Fatigue Inventory-Short Form (BFI-SF) NRS in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated daily worst fatigue score in an eDiary using the 11-point BFI-SF NRS, in which 0=no fatigue and 10=worst fatigue. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the postbaseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of the Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score Daily Worst Nausea Score as Measured by NRS in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated worst daily nausea score in an eDiary using an 11-point NRS, in which 0=no nausea and 10=worst nausea. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the postbaseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement. The 6-month AUC was calculated based on change from baseline in weekly mean scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Score Daily Worst Nausea Score as Measured by NRS in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated worst daily nausea score in an eDiary using an 11-point NRS, in which 0=no nausea and 10=worst nausea. Daily eDiary entries were averaged into a weekly (i.e. 7 day) score. The change from baseline in weekly mean scores is defined as the postbaseline weekly mean score minus the baseline score. Lower scores indicate an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Physical Component Summary (PCS) of the 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12) in Participants With AIP
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-12 is a survey designed for use in patients with multiple chronic conditions. This 12-item scale can be used to assess the physical and mental health of respondents. 10 of the 12 questions are answered on a 5 point likert scale and 2 are answered on a 3 point likert scale. The questions are then scored and weighted into 2 subscales, physical health and mental health. Respondents can have a score that ranges from 0-100 with 100 being the best score and indicating high physical or mental health. A 3 point change in SF-12 score reflects a meaningful difference. A higher score indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: Givosiran 2.5 mg/kg administered subcutaneously (SC), monthly (QM), for 6 months during the 6-Month Double-blind (DB) Period, followed by givosiran 2.5 mg/kg or 1.25 mg/kg SC, QM for 29 months during the Open-label Extension (OLE) Period.

Matching placebo (normal saline [0.9% NaCl]) was administered SC, QM, for 6 months during the 6-Month DB Period, followed by givosiran 2.5 mg/kg or 1.25 mg/kg SC, QM for 29 months during the OLE period.

intervention.description: Matching placebo (normal saline [0.9% NaCl]) by SC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- â‰¥ 12 years of age
- Diagnosed with Acute Hepatic Porphyria (Acute Intermittent Porphyria, Hereditary Corproporhyria, Variegate Porphyria, aminolevulinic acid (ALA) dehydratase deficient porphyria)
- Elevated urinary or plasma porphobilinogen (PBG) or ALA values within the past year,
- Have active disease, with at least 2 documented porphyria attacks within the last 6 months
- Willing to discontinue or not initiate the use of prophylactic hemin throughout the study.
- Women of child bearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test, not be nursing, and use acceptable contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant abnormal laboratory results
- Anticipated liver transplantation
- History of multiple drug allergies or intolerance to subcutaneous injections
- Active HIV, hepatitis C virus, or hepatitis B virus infection(s)
- History of recurrent pancreatitis

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants with acute hepatic porphyrias (AHP) were enrolled at thirty-six sites in Australia, Bulgaria, Canada, Germany, Denmark, Spain, Finland, France, United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, Korea (the Republic of), Mexico, Netherlands, Poland, Sweden, Taiwan and the United States.

group.title: Placebo/Givosiran
group.description: Matching placebo (normal saline [0.9% NaCl]) was administered subcutaneously (SC), monthly (QM), for 6 months during the 6-Month Double-blind (DB) Period, followed by givosiran 2.5 mg/kg or 1.25 mg/kg SC, QM for 29 months during the Open-label Extension (OLE) period.

group.title: Givosiran/Givosiran
group.description: Givosiran 2.5 mg/kg administered SC, QM, for 6 months during the 6-Month DB Period, followed by givosiran 2.5 mg/kg or 1.25 mg/kg SC, QM mg/kg for 29 months during the OLE Period.

participants_list.participants: 1 participant discontinued treatment during the 6-month DB period but completed the 6-month DB Visit

baseline.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAS) consisted of all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Placebo/Givosiran
group.description: Matching placebo (normal saline [0.9% NaCl]) was administered SC, QM, for 6 months during the 6-Month DB Period, followed by givosiran 2.5 mg/kg or 1.25 mg/kg SC, QM for 29 months during the OLE period.

group.title: Givosiran/Givosiran
group.description: Givosiran 2.5 mg/kg administered SC, QM, for 6 months during the 6-Month DB Period, followed by givosiran 2.5 mg/kg or 1.25 mg/kg SC, QM for 29 months during the OLE Period.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Annualized Rate of Porphyria Attacks in Participants With Acute Intermittent Porphyria (AIP)
outcome.description: Porphyria attacks were defined as meeting all of the following criteria: an acute episode of neurovisceral pain in the abdomen, back, chest, extremities and/or limbs, no other medically determined cause, and required treatment with intravenous (IV) dextrose or hemin, carbohydrates, or analgesics, or other medications such as antiemetics at a dose or frequency beyond the participant's usual daily porphyria management. The annualized rate of porphyria attacks is a composite endpoint which included porphyria attacks requiring hospitalization, urgent healthcare visit, or IV hemin administration at home.
outcome.population: AIP participants in the Full Analysis Set (FASAIP): All randomized AIP participants (with identified mutation in the hydroxymethylbilane synthase [HMBS] gene) who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo (normal saline [0.9% NaCl]) was administered SC, QM, for 6 months during the 6-Month DB Period.

group.title: Givosiran 2.5 mg/kg
group.description: Givosiran 2.5 mg/kg administered SC, QM, for 6 months during the 6-Month DB Period.

measure.title: Annualized Rate of Porphyria Attacks in Participants With Acute Intermittent Porphyria (AIP)
measure.description: Porphyria attacks were defined as meeting all of the following criteria: an acute episode of neurovisceral pain in the abdomen, back, chest, extremities and/or limbs, no other medically determined cause, and required treatment with intravenous (IV) dextrose or hemin, carbohydrates, or analgesics, or other medications such as antiemetics at a dose or frequency beyond the participant's usual daily porphyria management. The annualized rate of porphyria attacks is a composite endpoint which included porphyria attacks requiring hospitalization, urgent healthcare visit, or IV hemin administration at home.
measure.population: AIP participants in the Full Analysis Set (FASAIP): All randomized AIP participants (with identified mutation in the hydroxymethylbilane synthase [HMBS] gene) who received at least one dose of study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: Negative binomial regression model with treatment group and stratification factors (prior hemin prophylaxis status and historical attack rates) as fixed effects and the logarithm of the follow-up time as an offset variable.

outcome.description: The PD effect of givosiran was evaluated by spot urine ALA levels normalized to spot urine creatinine levels.
outcome.population: FASAIP: All randomized AIP participants (with identified mutation in the HMBS gene) who received at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Physical Component Summary (PCS) of the 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12) in Participants With AIP
outcome.description: The SF-12 is a survey designed for use in patients with multiple chronic conditions. This 12-item scale can be used to assess the physical and mental health of respondents. 10 of the 12 questions are answered on a 5 point likert scale and 2 are answered on a 3 point likert scale. The questions are then scored and weighted into 2 subscales, physical health and mental health. Respondents can have a score that ranges from 0-100 with 100 being the best score and indicating high physical or mental health. A 3 point change in SF-12 score reflects a meaningful difference. A higher score indicates improvement.
outcome.population: FASAIP: All randomized AIP participants (with identified mutation in the HMBS gene) who received at least one dose of study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
